title: Server Side Generate with Angular + Sculry
body:
## Introduction

`` `bash
$ NPM Config Set Legacy-Peer-Deps True
$ NPM RUN NG ADD @Scullyio/Init
`` `
* Legacy-Peer-Deps has been added because it failed due to NPM version problem when executed in the environment at hand.
* I used Puppeteer at the time of the test


## rendering

When introduced, it will be used because the command is added to `package.json`.
-Package.json

`` `json
{
"Scripts": {
...
"Scully": "NPX Scully -",
"Scully: Serve": "NPX SCULLY SERVE -"
},
...
},

`` `

To execute Sculy based on Build data, execute Build first and render.
`` `bash
$ NPM Run Build
$ NPM Run Scully
`` `

This outputs rendering results to the `DIST/STATIC` directory.


## Rendering dynamic path

In the rendering above, it is good if PATH is written directly in Router, but it is not output if you use a dynamic path such as `blog/: id`.

Therefore, add information to `Scully/Plugins/Plugin.ts`.

`` `TS
Import {RegisterPlugin, HandledRoute} from '@Scullyio/Scully';
Import Blogs from '../src/assets/articles/list.json';

CONST BLOGROUTES: HandledRoute [] = Object.Keys (Blogs) .map (Blogid => ({Route: `/Blog/{Blogid}`}}))

Function Blographsplugin (_route: String, _config = {}) {
  Return Promise.resolve (Blorroutes)
}

RegisterPlugin ('Router', "BLOGIDS", BLOGROUTESPLUGIN, [])

`` `

When you import JSON, you need to enable the `resolvejsonmodule` option of` Sculy/tsconfig.json`.

Since the plug -in is registered, the setting is described in `Routes` of` Scully. {Project_name} .config.ts`.

`` `TS
Import {Scullyconfig} from '@Scullyio/Scully';
Import './scully/plugins/plugin'

/** This Loads The Default Render Plugin, Remove Which Which Switching to Something Else.*//////
Import '@Scullyio/Scully-Plugin-Puppeteer'



EXPORT CONST CONFIG: Scullyconfig = {
  ProjectRoot: "./src",
  ProjectName: "Portal",
  // Add spsmodulepath WHENG DE SCULLY PLATFORM SERVER,
  outdir:'/dist/static ',
  Routes: {
    "/log/: ID": {
      Type: "Logids",
    },
    "/Blog/: ID": {
      Type: "Blogids",
    }
  }
};
`` `

After this setting, rendering will be performed by executing and building `NPM Run Sculy` again.

## Confirmation of generated files

You can host another command `NPM Run Scully: Serve`.

`` `bash
$ NPM Run Scully: Serve

> Portal@0.0.0 Scully: SERVE
> NPX SCULLY SERVE-

  ✔ Starting Servers for Project "Portal"
  ✔ Started Scully Static Server ON "http: // localhost: 1668/"
  ✔ Started Angular Distribution Server ON "http: // localhost: 1864/"
`` `

The advantage of setting ## SSG

-Ogp such as images, titles, explanations, etc. set in JS will be displayed properly.
-There are files, eliminating redirect processing when using GitHub Pages, CloudFlare Pages, etc.

It is a day to struggle with the index processing of Google Search Console, so I hope to improve it ...
